awards.summary: Received the scholarship for being amongst the top 10 Computer Science exam candidates, Allowing me to enter University a year earlier
awards.title: 2014 Computer Science Scholarship

basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.name: Tyler Hale
basics.summary: Started programming in high-school, leaving a year early with a scholarship to Waikato University while simultaneously being part of building Nyriad. Actively jumped into new and existing projects which required leadership, management, and problem solving • Developer who likes to explore different areas of programming, typically found trying out faster and automated ways to improve CI/CD, machine infrastructure and anything that causes developer friction • Heavily involved in building infrastructure that supports Nvidia GPUs, including effective storage and data science stacks that use them • This lead to following Dev-Ops practices and has been a key aspect of working with tools such as Kubernetes, Kibana, Docker, Terraform, Ansible, and Jenkins.

courses: COMP316 Artificial Intelligence Techniques and Applications
COMP317 Design and Analysis of Algorithms
COMP221 Introduction to 3D Modelling and Animation

highlights: LUCE a containerized GPU data-science stack for Scion to process its New Zealand LiDAR data
Nsulate integrations into distributed storage systems
Various internal tools and dashboards for developers
work.position: Software Developer, Development Lead, Sales Engineer
work.summary: One of the first to join, have been actively involved throughout the entire journey. Part of Product Management; Working on strategy, feature definition, road-mapping and release process.
